alert.note: Alert for Baker; Bradford; Clay; Duval; Flagler; Putnam; St. Johns (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 17 at 5:09AM EST until further notice by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northeast and northern Florida, including the following counties, in northeast Florida, Baker, Clay, Duval, Flagler, Putnam and St. Johns. In northern Florida, Alachua, Bradford, Marion and Union. * WHEN...Until 800 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 507 AM EST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rainfall across the warning area has been in the range of 3 to 5 inches, with a few locations getting 6 inches. Heavy rain is gradually decreasing from S to N across the warning areas, but areas around Jacksonville could get another inch of rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. The flooding will be worst in areas with poor drainage. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Jacksonville, Gainesville, Palm Coast, Ocala, Saint Augustine, Palatka, Orange Park, Green Cove Springs, Starke, Rainbow Lakes Estates, Flagler Beach, Bunnell, Crescent City, Interlachen, Keystone Heights, Pomona Park, Hastings, Melrose, East Palatka and Fort McCoy. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: Baker; Bradford; Clay; Duval; Flagler; Putnam; St. Johns
